item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, March 12, 2025 at 3:25 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Happy 20th Birthday, Y Combinator (970 points | 201 comments)
2. Happy 10k Day (49 points | 22 comments)
3. Show HN: VSC – An open source 3D Rendering Engine in C++ (6 points | discuss)
4. Why I love Bluey (and hate Cocomelon) (18 points | 4 comments)
5. Fastplotlib: GPU-accelerated, fast, and interactive plotting library (353 points | 129 comments)
6. New tools for building agents (290 points | 107 comments)
7. The Startup CTO's Handbook (114 points | 22 comments)
8. Sorting algorithms with CUDA (54 points | 15 comments)
9. Show HN: Factorio Learning Environment – Agents Build Factories (629 points | 184 comments)
10. NASA to launch space observatory that will map 450M galaxies (188 points | 71 comments)
11. Launch HN: Sift Dev (YC W25) – AI-Powered Datadog Alternative (56 points | 41 comments)
12. Show HN: We built a Plug-in Home Battery for the 99.7% of us without Powerwalls (241 points | 343 comments)
13. Australian man survives 100 days with artificial heart in world-first success (91 points | 5 comments)
14. The US island that speaks Elizabethan English (206 points | 113 comments)
15. A 10x Faster TypeScript (1452 points | 653 comments)
16. In contrast to Earth, Mars's middle atmosphere appears driven by gravity waves (53 points | 13 comments)
17. Tesco trials giant trolley scales in Gateshead (7 points | 11 comments)
18. Continue (YC S23) Is Hiring a Software Engineer in San Francisco ( | hide)
19. Show HN: Krep a High-Performance String Search Utility Written in C (125 points | 53 comments)
20. The Early History of Deferred Shading and Lighting (8 points | 1 comment)
21. When Crocodiles Attack: The Ramree Island Massacre (2013) (41 points | 41 comments)
22. Backyard Cyanide (114 points | 46 comments)
23. NIST selects HQC as fifth algorithm for post-quantum encryption (138 points | 100 comments)
24. What Is It Like to Be a Bass? Fish-Eye View Photography (1919–22) (9 points | 3 comments)
25. Modern Baby: A pioneering computer from Manchester (58 points | 7 comments)
26. What makes code hard to read: Visual patterns of complexity (2023) (290 points | 282 comments)
27. Mapping the University of Chicago's 135-year expansion into Hyde Park and beyond (193 points | 66 comments)
28. Unix Needs a True Integrated Environment: CASE Closed (1989) [pdf] (29 points | 10 comments)
29. Smart researchers pioneer nanosensor for real-time iron detection in plants (25 points | 2 comments)
30. America Is Missing The New Labor Economy – Robotics Part 1 (169 points | 258 comments)
